result.markdown:
# Common Statistical Tests {#stats}


::: {.cell}

:::


R includes a large number of functions to perform statistical hypothesis testing in the built-in `stats` package. This chapter includes a brief overview of the syntax for some common tests along with code to produce relevant plots of your data.

## Correlation test


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_dbe688457510ed77985cec3869c1ef37'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(2020)
x <- rnorm(100)
y1 <- .1 * x + rnorm(100)
y2 <- .3 * x + rnorm(100)
y3 <- x + rnorm(100)/5
y4 <- x^2 + rnorm(100)
```
:::


Scatterplot with linear fit:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_3c3a22b0d7898015443ae59e7d3e0fa9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(x, y1,
     col = "#00000077",
     pch = 16, bty = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): semi-transparency is not supported on this
device: reported only once per page
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
abline(lm(y1 ~ x), col = "red", lwd = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_cc55f1c371239ef79532aff202923960'}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(x, y2,
     col = "#00000077",
     pch = 16, bty = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): semi-transparency is not supported on this
device: reported only once per page
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
abline(lm(y3 ~ x), col = "red", lwd = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_a30232e38c715400ceead02be5296d1b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(x, y3,
     col = "#00000077",
     pch = 16, bty = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): semi-transparency is not supported on this
device: reported only once per page
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
abline(lm(y3 ~ x), col = "red", lwd = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::


Scatterplot with a LOESS fit


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_44356c84bf785aa984f9af7bcb6eb572'}

```{.r .cell-code}
scatter.smooth(x, y4,
               col = "#00000077",
               pch = 16, bty = "none",
               lpars = list(col = "red", lwd = 2))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): semi-transparency is not supported on this
device: reported only once per page
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_92b34d2d62cb47603f31212e56490af6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cor.test(x, y1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  x and y1
t = 0.66018, df = 98, p-value = 0.5107
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.1315978  0.2595659
sample estimates:
       cor 
0.06654026 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cor.test(x, y2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  x and y2
t = 3.3854, df = 98, p-value = 0.001024
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.1357938 0.4889247
sample estimates:
      cor 
0.3235813 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cor.test(x, y3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  x and y3
t = 53.689, df = 98, p-value < 2.2e-16
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.9754180 0.9888352
sample estimates:
      cor 
0.9834225 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cor.test(x, y4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  x and y4
t = 0.66339, df = 98, p-value = 0.5086
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.1312793  0.2598681
sample estimates:
       cor 
0.06686289 
```
:::
:::

## Student's t-test


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_e720af912dcb210d15e47d64eb5d9ee8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(2021)
x0 <- rnorm(500)
x1 <- rnorm(500, mean = .7)
```
:::


For all tests of differences in means, a boxplot is a good way to visualize. It accepts individual vectors, list or data.frame of vectors, or a formula to split a vector into groups by a factor.


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_5b00c5538f5a9d3fa7fe3e97d45f445f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
boxplot(x0, x1,
        col = "#05204999", border = "#052049",
        boxwex = .3, names = c("x0", "x1"))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in xypolygon(xx, yy, lty = "blank", col = boxfill[i]):
semi-transparency is not supported on this device: reported only once per page
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::


### One sample t-test


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_737da1194cf11a4ea56a7cd6bd19f1cc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(x0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	One Sample t-test

data:  x0
t = 0.093509, df = 499, p-value = 0.9255
alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.08596896  0.09456106
sample estimates:
  mean of x 
0.004296046 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_f8616fc11d06896836762d5b72ab11db'}

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(x1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	One Sample t-test

data:  x1
t = 15.935, df = 499, p-value < 2.2e-16
alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.6322846 0.8101311
sample estimates:
mean of x 
0.7212079 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_eb334ad750ac9ab3987a7ff537ed6a61'}

```{.r .cell-code}
boxplot(extra ~ group, data = sleep,
        col = "#05204999", border = "#052049",
        boxwex = .3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in xypolygon(xx, yy, lty = "blank", col = boxfill[i]):
semi-transparency is not supported on this device: reported only once per page
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::


### Two-sample T-test

Both `t.test()` and `wilcox.test()` (below) either accept input as two vectors, 
`t.test(x, y)` or a formula of the form `t.test(x ~ group)`. The `paired` argument allows us to define a paired test. Since the `sleep` dataset includes measurements on the same cases in two conditions, we set `paired = TRUE`.


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_1b643628e1ca0b2dfdd4264ff3a0c86c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(extra ~ group, data = sleep, paired = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Paired t-test

data:  extra by group
t = -4.0621, df = 9, p-value = 0.002833
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -2.4598858 -0.7001142
sample estimates:
mean difference 
          -1.58 
```
:::
:::


## Wilcoxon test

Data from R Documentation:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_11f5edfab53333bc344ebad1aa2f7117'}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Hollander & Wolfe (1973), 29f.
## Hamilton depression scale factor measurements in 9 patients with
##  mixed anxiety and depression, taken at the first (x) and second
##  (y) visit after initiation of a therapy (administration of a
##  tranquilizer).
x <- c(1.83,  0.50,  1.62,  2.48, 1.68, 1.88, 1.55, 3.06, 1.30)
y <- c(0.878, 0.647, 0.598, 2.05, 1.06, 1.29, 1.06, 3.14, 1.29)
depression <- data.frame(first = x, second = y, change = y - x)
```
:::


### One-sample Wilcoxon 


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_bfcc314aebbc39a2cf40ef1e092d3382'}

```{.r .cell-code}
wilcox.test(depression$change)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon signed rank exact test

data:  depression$change
V = 5, p-value = 0.03906
alternative hypothesis: true location is not equal to 0
```
:::
:::


### Two-sample Wilcoxon rank sum test (unpaired)

a.k.a Mann-Whitney U test a.k.a. Mann–Whitney–Wilcoxon (MWW) a.k.a. Wilcoxon–Mann–Whitney test


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_b5cd0722ce0b64dbcf7e4b999d2edbc8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x1 <- rnorm(500, 3, 1.5)
x2 <- rnorm(500, 5, 2)
wilcox.test(x1, x2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction

data:  x1 and x2
W = 47594, p-value < 2.2e-16
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0
```
:::
:::


### Two-sample Wilcoxon signed-rank test (paired)


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_3f8c85189f5760198b0724068d1ffb76'}

```{.r .cell-code}
wilcox.test(x, y, paired = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon signed rank exact test

data:  x and y
V = 40, p-value = 0.03906
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_ff5a4e7a3b57c45c3686b741915bc712'}

```{.r .cell-code}
wilcox.test(x, y, paired = TRUE, alternative = "greater")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon signed rank exact test

data:  x and y
V = 40, p-value = 0.01953
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is greater than 0
```
:::
:::


## Analysis of Variance


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_625c4e03b1f357bf89047039db761c81'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(20)
BP_drug <- data.frame(Group = factor(rep(c("Placebo", "Drug_A", "Drug_B"), each = 20),
                                     levels = c("Placebo", "Drug_A", "Drug_B")),
                  SBP = c(rnorm(20, 140, 2.2), rnorm(20, 132, 2.1), rnorm(20, 138, 2)))
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_b1e8cea3fe1a06dc64a0c5c8f8c7dfb7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
boxplot(SBP ~ Group, data = BP_drug,
        col = "#05204999", border = "#052049",
        boxwex = .3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in xypolygon(xx, yy, lty = "blank", col = boxfill[i]):
semi-transparency is not supported on this device: reported only once per page
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_053c07b743503122bd298512002252fc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
SBP_aov <- aov(SBP ~ Group, data = BP_drug)
SBP_aov
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call:
   aov(formula = SBP ~ Group, data = BP_drug)

Terms:
                   Group Residuals
Sum of Squares  728.2841  264.4843
Deg. of Freedom        2        57

Residual standard error: 2.154084
Estimated effects may be unbalanced
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-22_3e00086c282acdfe19fe3583e9dde3a5'}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(SBP_aov)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)    
Group        2  728.3   364.1   78.48 <2e-16 ***
Residuals   57  264.5     4.6                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


The analysis of variance p-value is highly significant, but doesn't tell us which levels of the Group factor are significantly different from each other. The boxplot already gives us a pretty good idea, but we can follow up with a pairwise t-test 

### Pot-hoc pairwise t-tests


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-23_e4c0b8a5aebdf5dedabf7db218a658ee'}

```{.r .cell-code}
pairwise.t.test(BP_drug$SBP, BP_drug$Group,
                p.adj = "holm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pairwise comparisons using t tests with pooled SD 

data:  BP_drug$SBP and BP_drug$Group 

       Placebo Drug_A 
Drug_A 2.9e-16 -      
Drug_B 0.065   1.7e-13

P value adjustment method: holm 
```
:::
:::


The pairwise tests suggest that the difference between Placebo and Drug_A and between Drug_a and Drug_b are highly significant, while difference between Placebo and Drub_B is not (p = 0.065).

## Kruskal-Wallis test

Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test of the null that the location parameters of the distribution of x are the same in each group (sample). The alternative is that they differ in at least one. It is a generalization of the Wilcoxon test to multiple independent samples.

From the R Documentation:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-24_9a13533e56299749075167a08a7f3fac'}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Hollander & Wolfe (1973), 116.
## Mucociliary efficiency from the rate of removal of dust in normal
##  subjects, subjects with obstructive airway disease, and subjects
##  with asbestosis.
x <- c(2.9, 3.0, 2.5, 2.6, 3.2) # normal subjects
y <- c(3.8, 2.7, 4.0, 2.4)      # with obstructive airway disease
z <- c(2.8, 3.4, 3.7, 2.2, 2.0) # with asbestosis
kruskal.test(list(x, y, z))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test

data:  list(x, y, z)
Kruskal-Wallis chi-squared = 0.77143, df = 2, p-value = 0.68
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-25_c32b7b5b151c6f0c33549348f65b93e6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
boxplot(Ozone ~ Month, data = airquality,
        col = "#05204999", border = "#052049",
        boxwex = .3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in xypolygon(xx, yy, lty = "blank", col = boxfill[i]):
semi-transparency is not supported on this device: reported only once per page
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-26_60182f51be71bb417ec411ad82e192e0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
kruskal.test(Ozone ~ Month, data = airquality)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test

data:  Ozone by Month
Kruskal-Wallis chi-squared = 29.267, df = 4, p-value = 6.901e-06
```
:::
:::


## Chi-squared Test

Pearson's chi-squared test for count data

Some synthetic data:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-27_fa6331cf73095afdbb1eb5e7da99f6ba'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(2021)
set.seed(2021)
Cohort <- factor(sample(c("Control", "Case"), size = 500, replace = TRUE),
                 levels = c("Control", "Case"))
Sex <- factor(
  sapply(seq(Cohort), \(i) sample(c("Male", "Female"), size = 1,
                                  prob = if (Cohort[i] == "Control") c(1, 1) else c(2, 1))))
dat <- data.frame(Cohort, Sex)
head(dat)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
   Cohort    Sex
1 Control   Male
2    Case   Male
3    Case   Male
4    Case Female
5 Control Female
6    Case   Male
```
:::
:::


You can lot count data using a [mosaic plot](#mosaicplot), with either a table or formula input:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-28_afb18780194561b88dec592a0ac649f2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mosaicplot(table(Cohort, Sex),
           color = c("orchid", "skyblue"),
           border = NA,
           main = "Cohort x Sex")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-29_e374bab702728ef26cc1add81588530d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mosaicplot(Cohort ~ Sex, dat,
           color = c("orchid", "skyblue"),
           border = NA,
           main = "Cohort x Sex")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-29-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::


`chisq.test()` accepts either two factors, or a table:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-30_6bf79eab8ff7aa864a803acd5c4bbad6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cohort_sex_chisq <- chisq.test(dat$Cohort, dat$Sex)
cohort_sex_chisq
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's Chi-squared test with Yates' continuity correction

data:  dat$Cohort and dat$Sex
X-squared = 18.015, df = 1, p-value = 2.192e-05
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-31_d1e8fab2a7b3ed5b1b11aa3d451dd4fb'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cohort_sex_chisq <- chisq.test(table(dat$Cohort, dat$Sex))
cohort_sex_chisq
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's Chi-squared test with Yates' continuity correction

data:  table(dat$Cohort, dat$Sex)
X-squared = 18.015, df = 1, p-value = 2.192e-05
```
:::
:::



## Fisher's exact test

Fisher's exact test for count data

Working on the same data as above, `fisher.test()` also accepts either two factors or a table as input:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-32_276d420d827867975e5b58f4e6844705'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cohort_sex_fisher <- fisher.test(dat$Cohort, dat$Sex)
cohort_sex_fisher
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data

data:  dat$Cohort and dat$Sex
p-value = 1.512e-05
alternative hypothesis: true odds ratio is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 1.516528 3.227691
sample estimates:
odds ratio 
  2.207866 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-33_3468094ed0453ed4c232ac05fff50b16'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cohort_sex_fisher <- fisher.test(table(dat$Cohort, dat$Sex))
cohort_sex_fisher
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data

data:  table(dat$Cohort, dat$Sex)
p-value = 1.512e-05
alternative hypothesis: true odds ratio is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 1.516528 3.227691
sample estimates:
odds ratio 
  2.207866 
```
:::
:::


## F Test to compare two variances


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-34_a3ddf53fc8232e3bc2cfb5d233befb20'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x1 <- rnorm(500, sd = 1)
x2 <- rnorm(400, sd = 1.5)
var.test(x1, x2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  x1 and x2
F = 0.43354, num df = 499, denom df = 399, p-value < 2.2e-16
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.3594600 0.5218539
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
         0.4335363 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-35_9aa1d2b2eb6b67b63ed2daa8d0c32993'}

```{.r .cell-code}
boxplot(x1, x2,
        col = "#05204999", border = "#052049",
        boxwex = .3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in xypolygon(xx, yy, lty = "blank", col = boxfill[i]):
semi-transparency is not supported on this device: reported only once per page
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-35-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::


From R Documentation:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-36_3e6c50291366b6b922a2c940a79103d4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- rnorm(50, mean = 0, sd = 2)
y <- rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 1)
var.test(x, y)                  # Do x and y have the same variance?
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  x and y
F = 5.4776, num df = 49, denom df = 29, p-value = 5.817e-06
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
  2.752059 10.305597
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
          5.477573 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
var.test(lm(x ~ 1), lm(y ~ 1))  # same
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  lm(x ~ 1) and lm(y ~ 1)
F = 5.4776, num df = 49, denom df = 29, p-value = 5.817e-06
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
  2.752059 10.305597
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
          5.477573 
```
:::
:::


## Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

Performs Bartlett's test of the null that the variances in each of the groups (samples) are the same.

From the R Documentation:


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-37_dd7d60afd2c7aa3dc5d9535649c9ee0b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(count ~ spray, data = InsectSprays)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-37-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-38_dc3a09952de6928366a56d18e582eb59'}

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(InsectSprays$count, InsectSprays$spray)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  InsectSprays$count and InsectSprays$spray
Bartlett's K-squared = 25.96, df = 5, p-value = 9.085e-05
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-39_ed755ffe29f9e28e171dcecd10b6f3e7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(count ~ spray, data = InsectSprays)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  count by spray
Bartlett's K-squared = 25.96, df = 5, p-value = 9.085e-05
```
:::
:::


## Fligner-Killeen test of homogeneity of variances

Performs a Fligner-Killeen (median) test of the 
null that the variances in each of the groups (samples) are the same.


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-40_8c36bc24580cd3686e2fb78914d97466'}

```{.r .cell-code}
boxplot(count ~ spray, data = InsectSprays)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-40-1.png){width=480}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# works the same if you do plot(count ~ spray, data = InsectSprays)
fligner.test(InsectSprays$count, InsectSprays$spray)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Fligner-Killeen test of homogeneity of variances

data:  InsectSprays$count and InsectSprays$spray
Fligner-Killeen:med chi-squared = 14.483, df = 5, p-value = 0.01282
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
fligner.test(count ~ spray, data = InsectSprays)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Fligner-Killeen test of homogeneity of variances

data:  count by spray
Fligner-Killeen:med chi-squared = 14.483, df = 5, p-value = 0.01282
```
:::
:::


## Ansari-Bradley test

Performs the Ansari-Bradley two-sample test for a difference in scale parameters.


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-41_179c1c8847204edfd76e98d899dbd2ce'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ramsay <- c(111, 107, 100, 99, 102, 106, 109, 108, 104, 99,
            101, 96, 97, 102, 107, 113, 116, 113, 110, 98)
jung.parekh <- c(107, 108, 106, 98, 105, 103, 110, 105, 104,
            100, 96, 108, 103, 104, 114, 114, 113, 108, 106, 99)
ansari.test(ramsay, jung.parekh)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in ansari.test.default(ramsay, jung.parekh): cannot compute exact
p-value with ties
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Ansari-Bradley test

data:  ramsay and jung.parekh
AB = 185.5, p-value = 0.1815
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of scales is not equal to 1
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-42_ef1cb907fdb541f7a3b977bb8ba690bf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- rnorm(40, sd = 1.5)
y <- rnorm(40, sd = 2.5)
ansari.test(x, y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Ansari-Bradley test

data:  x and y
AB = 963, p-value = 0.005644
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of scales is not equal to 1
```
:::
:::


## Mood two-sample test of scale


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-43_4c3cc096457641e8fe687e27c81bf71f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mood.test(x, y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Mood two-sample test of scale

data:  x and y
Z = -2.7363, p-value = 0.006213
alternative hypothesis: two.sided
```
:::
:::


## Kolmogorov-Smirnoff test

Perform a one- or two-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test
Null: x and y were drawn from the same continuous distribution.


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-44_9e9016887ae38ec60b9ff5953c863e7d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x1 <- rnorm(200, 0, 1)
x2 <- rnorm(200, -.5, 1.5)
ks.test(x1, x2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Asymptotic two-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test

data:  x1 and x2
D = 0.35, p-value = 4.579e-11
alternative hypothesis: two-sided
```
:::
:::


## Shapiro-Wilk test of normality


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-45_91b3a11fc662bba6ba4d761e6e4eed8c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(2021)
x <- rnorm(2000)
y1 <- .7 * x
y2 <- x + x^3
```
:::


### Q-Q Plot


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-46_eb3e9b0bad877a29462a1f29874d36e8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqplot(rnorm(300), y1, pch = 16, col = "#00000077")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): semi-transparency is not supported on this
device: reported only once per page
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqline(y1, col = "red", lwd = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-46-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-47_596685a60f54d908206798fcc27d698c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqplot(rnorm(300), y2, pch = 16, col = "#00000077")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): semi-transparency is not supported on this
device: reported only once per page
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqline(y2, col = "red", lwd = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HypothesisTesting_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-47-1.png){width=480}
:::
:::


## Shapiro-Wilk test


::: {.cell hash='HypothesisTesting_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-48_27515038d955957398ac90d09b216fc8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(y1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  y1
W = 0.99952, p-value = 0.9218
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(y2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  y2
W = 0.72936, p-value < 2.2e-16
```
:::
:::
